explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Flash point: <23degC, Initial boiling point: >35degC, UNRTDG Class: 3, PG II

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Calculated based on rat LD50 values: 460mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001, DFGOT vol.13, 1999, PATTY 4th, 1994), 560mg/kg, 730mg/kg and 1029mg/kg (DFGOT vol.13, 1999). Since the calculated values was 471.8mg/kg, it was set as Category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 3 based on rabbit LD50 values: 420mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001), 415mg/kg, 578mg/kg (DFGOT vol.13, 1999), and 416mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1994).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hours): 1250ppm (equivalent: 5.163mg/L) and 2600 ppm (equivalent: 10.74mg/L) (DFGOT vol.13, 1999), lower value was adopted. 1250ppm could be judged as the steam with almost no mist from vapor pressure. And classified according to the ppm concentration standard, it was classified as Category 3.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 1A-1C from description that caustic was admitted in the skin irritation test using the rabbit (ACGIH (7th, 2001), DFGOT (vol.13, 1999)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is the description that in the eye irritation tests using the rabbit, caustic was acknowledged (ACGIH (7th, 2001) and DFGOT (vol.13, 1999)). So it was set as Category 1.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory organ: No data. Skin: We classified it as Out Of Category based on the description in DFGOT (vol.13, 1999) that in the ear-swelling test using the mouse, sensitizing property was not acknowledged.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (central nervous system, respiratory organs)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Description that effect is acknowledged to the central nervous systems in humans evidence of exposure of ACGIH (7th, 2001), and description that visual disturbances is seen in humans evidence of exposure of ACGIH (7th, 2001), DFGOT (vol.13, 1999), and IRIS (2005), and description that change of brain wave is acknowleged in the humans of PATTY (4th, 1994), and it was set as Category 1 (central nervous systems). Moreover, in the inhalation exposure test (exposure time unknowns) using the mouse of ACGIH (7th, 2001), from the description that the decrease in breathing rate is acknowledged by the low concentrations which is 156 - 180ppm, and it is corrosiveness, and it was set as Category 1 (respiratory tracts).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (central nervous system) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the description that in the repeated oral administration test using the rat, the effects on the central nervous systems were observed within the Category 1 guidance value range (ACGIH (7th, 2001) and DFGOT (vol.13, 1999)), and the description that in the occupational evidence of exposure in humans, visual disturbances are observed (ACGIH (7th, 2001), DFGOT (vol.13, 1999), and IRIS (Access on Sep 2005)), it was classified into Category 1 (central nervous systems).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 72-hour ErC50=8mg/L of the algae(Selenastrum) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 1999).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2, since acute toxicity was Category 2 and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 28% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bio-accumulative (BCF<4.9 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).
